title: Clark, Sam -- Radio Personality and Producer of the Record Black Americans
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Sam Clark discuss Clark's record Black Americans, a record that addresses Blacks and the United States Bicentennial, and whether or not the Black man is still fighting the United States government.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
subject: United States Bicentennial; African Americans in radio broadcasting

title: Greaves, William -- Independent Filmmaker and Producer of From These Roots
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and William Greaves discuss how Black filmmakers during the 1960s and 1970s moved to the forefront of independent filmmakers.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
subject: Filmmakers; African Americans

title: Maynard, Joan -- Executive Director of the Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford-Stuyvesant History
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joan Maynard discuss Weeksville, a community where freed slaves settled during the first half of the 19th Century. They also speak about the Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford-Stuyvesant History, which was initially created in order to restore three houses within the original perimeter of Weeksville.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
subject: Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford-Stuyvesant History; Weeksville

title: Stewart, Ruth Ann -- Assistant Curator for the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture of the New York Public Library
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ruth Ann Stewart discuss the history and collection of the New York Public Library's Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem. They also discuss funding for a new facility since outgrowing its 135th Street location.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
subject: New York Public Library; Harlem; Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture

title: Rhoden, John, Romare Bearden, and Larry Wilson -- A Sculptor, an Artist, and a Representative from Philip Morris, Inc.
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., artists Romare Bearden and John Roden, and sponsor Larry Wilson discuss the Brooklyn Museum of Art's exhibition Two Centuries of Black American Art.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
subject: Brooklyn Museum of Art; African American arts

title: Dr. Brown, Dr. Feinstein and Ambassador Ogbu on Nigerian Patriot Aminu Kano
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Dr. Alan Feinstein, and Ambassador Ogbu of Nigeria discuss the life of Nigerian patriot Aminu Kano.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
subject: Nigeria; Aminu Kano;

title: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and James P. Murray on the Entertainment Industry and Black Performing Artists
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and James P. Murray discuss the business aspect of the entertainment industry, including how commercialism affects the relationship between Black performing artists and business entrepreneurs.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
contributor: Murray, James (Film Critic, Film Editor, Editor)
subject: Entertainment industry; Black performing artists; Commercialism; Entertainment business

title: Dr. Brown, Professor Perkins, and Professor Foner on Controversial Books About Slavery
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., William Eric Perkins, and Eric Foner discuss controversial new books about Blacks during slavery, including Charles Wesley's Roll, Jordan, Roll.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
subject: Slavery; Enslaved peoples; Charles Wesley; Books

title: Dr. Brown, Bob Moore, and Jean Carrie Bond on Racial Stereotypes in Children's Books
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Bob Moore, and Jean Carrie Bond discuss racial stereotypes found in books for children.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
contributor: Moore, Bob (Council Representative); Bond, Jean (Council Representative)
subject: Books; Children's books; Stereotypes; Racial stereotypes

title: Dr. Brown and Dr. Jackson Christmas on Mental Health in Black Communities
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. June Jackson Christmas discuss the increase in mental health issues within the Black community following the recent economic crisis. They also discuss the programs available to the Black community to treat these issues.
creator: Brown Jr., Roscoe C
contributor: Jackson Christmas, June (Commissioner of Mental Health Services)
subject: Mental health; Economic crisis; Community

title: Kornblum, William, Herb Cables, and Frances Gibson -- Representatives from the Gateway National Recreational Center of the National Park Service
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., William Kornblum, Herb Cables, and Frances Gibson discuss plans for the federally funded Gateway National Park.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
contributor: Kornblum, William (Representative of Gateway National Park, employed by the National Park Service); Cables, Herb (Representative of Gateway National Park, employed by the National Park Service); Gibson, Frances (Representative of Gateway National Park, employed by the National Park Service)
subject: Gateway National Park

title: Walker, Jim -- Book Editor and Advertising Manager for Black Creation Magazine
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Jim Walker discuss themes in contemporary Black writing and the forms of Black literature they feel are most expressive of the Black experience.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
contributor: Walker, Jim (Book Editor and Advertising Manager for Black Creation Magazine)
subject: Literature--Black authors;

title: Robeson, Paul, Jr.-- Head of the Paul Robeson Archives
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Paul Robeson, Jr. discuss fundraising for and the processing of the Paul Robeson Archives, which documents Robeson's life as an actor, singer, and figure of the civil rights movement.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
contributor: Robeson, Paul, Jr. (Head of the Paul Robeson Archives)
subject: Civil rights; Civil rights workers; Archives; cataloging;

title: Dempsey, Ellen, Robert Williams, and Florence Jackson -- Two Representatives from the New York City Bicentennial Corporation and the Director of Social Studies for New York City Board of Education
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Ellen Dempsey, Robert Williams, and Florence Jackson discuss the various school and community projects prompted by the Bicentennial.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
contributor: Dempsey, Ellen (Representative from the New York City Bicentennial Corporation); Williams, Robert (Representative from the New York City Bicentennial Corporation); Jackson, Florence (Director of Social Studies for New York City Board of Education)
subject: Education; Communities; Social sciences; American Revolution Bicentennial, 1976

title: Bryant, Linda -- Director of the Just Above Midtown Gallery
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Linda Bryant discuss the opening of the Just Above Midtown Gallery at 50 West 57 Street, a gallery formed to promote 20th-century Afro-American artists.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
contributor: Bryant, Linda (Director of the Just Above Midtown Gallery)
subject: Art, Black; Art museums

title: Stewart, Ellen -- La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ellen Stewart discuss international theatre, including La MaMa's decision to begin touring Europe in 1965 when critics were not reviewing their shows.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
subject: International Theatre (New York, N.Y.); La MaMa; MaMa's pushcart; Europe

title: Cooper, Jocelyn and Patricia Dempsey -- Coordinator of Foods and Nutrition of the Council Against Poverty and the Community Development Agency, and the Deputy Director of Food-Stamp Alert
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Jocelyn Cooper, and Patricia Dempsey discuss why over a million Black individuals who are eligible for food stamps are not receiving such benefits.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
subject: Food stamp program; Economic assistance; African Americans; Black people; New York

title: Taylor, Emory -- Director of the Harlem Opera Society
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Emory Taylor discuss the history and work of the Harlem Opera Society, which was responsible for 40 performances a year, including two to three Black operas in the New York metropolitan area.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
subject: Black people in opera; Harlem (New York, N.Y.); Opera

title: Capers, Virginia -- Actress in the Musical Raisin
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Virginia Capers discuss the musical Raisin.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
subject: Musicals; Musical theater; Race in musical theater; African American theater; New York

title: Pigatt, Anderson -- Sculptor
description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Anderson Pigatt discuss the role of the Black artist at a time when the recognition of the Black artist was increasing across the United States and, in New York City, many Black artists were opening their own galleries.
creator: Brown, Roscoe C, Jr.
subject: Artists, Black; Sculptors--United States; African American sculptors
